author: Corky Emrick
title: Bronson volleyball wins Polish Classic
text: Bronson volleyball wins Polish Classic No. 1 Lady Vikes take care of business at home Comment Posted Oct. 4, 2015 at 4:04 PM Bronson, Centreville and Marcellus all won volleyball invitationals Saturday. Polish Classic Bronson was a perfect 12-0, including a 25-18, 25-23 win over Onsted to take first in the Polish Classic. The Lady Vikings opened with wins over Edwardsburg 25-18, 25-14, Onsted 25-20, 25-12 and Napoleon 25-20, 25-15. In the quarterfinals Bronson beat LMC 25-10, 25-12 and in the semifinals defeated Napoleon 25-19, 25-10. Alexa Ratkowski had 120 assists, 26 kills, 24 digs, four aces and two blocks, Jill Pyles added 34 kills, 10 digs and 14 aces, Kiana Mayer had 13 kills, 10 assists, five digs and four blocks and Kirin Cekander recorded 38 kills, 59 digs and 10 aces. Allie Sikorski had 18 kills, 39 digs and nine aces, Adyson Lasky 18 digs, six aces and three assists, Kelcy Sikorski added eight digs, Ashston Wronikowski had 12 kills, four blocks and three digs and Kelsey Robinson had four digs and one ace. Clare Mayes had three kills, two digs and one block, Kiera Lasky added 55 digs, 10 aces, five kills and three assists and Jenna Smoker had six digs and five kills. Sturgis also took part in the Polish Classic, placing second in pool play, then falling to Napoleon in the quarterfinals 25-18, 25-11. The Lady Trojans opened the day with a loss to Jackson Lumen Christi 30-28, 28-26. They went on to beat Hillsdale 19-25, 25-17, 17-15 and beat LMC 19-25, 25-19, 15-9. They took on Napoleon in the quarterfinals. Paige Robinson had 21 kills, one block and five digs, Hannah Bronstetter added 19 kills, eight digs and six blocks, Brianna Wheeler had 58 assists, 16 digs and two blocks, Nikki Nelson added three blocks and one dig and Camryn Hamlin had 12 kills, one block, 11 digs and one assist. Paige Andrews had 28 digs, eight kills and five assists. Harmony Groves had three kills and 39 digs, Morgan Pueschel added 67 digs and one kill, Cloie LaRoy had four digs and one kill, Lexi Mazzoni had six digs and one kill, Baylee Smith had one assist, Rachel Huff added three digs and Kayla Nichols had four digs. Concord Invite Centreville defeated Jonesville 22-25, 25-13, 15-10 to take first place in the Concord Invitational Saturday. The Lady Bulldogs opened tourney action in pool play with a 26-24, 25-18 win over Olivet, then splitting with Concord 25-23, 22-25 and split with Adrian Maddison 25-18, 22-25 in crossover play. In the semifinals, Centreville defeated Olivet 25-21, 24-26, 15-7 and went on to beat Jonesville in the finals. Hannah Marchand had 54 kills, 42 digs, seven blocks, six assists and three aces, Bailee May added 47 digs, 36 kills, 11 blocks and one assist and Madison Hunter had 58 assists, 39 digs, five kills, five aces and four blocks. Skyler DeMeyer had 50 assists, 62 digs, 21 kills, four blocks and one ace, Carlee Odom had 10 digs, five blocks and two assists, Sara Lewis added 40 digs, two kills and two assists, Kayla Gest had three assists and two aces, Kaylee Schrock added 30 digs, seven aces, six kills, three blocks and one assist, Hannah Rice had four digs and three assists and Andrea Bell had one dig. Page 2 of 2 - “The freshmen, JV and varsity teams all brought home first place plaques for their respective tournaments. I can’t be any more proud of this program, these girls, my coaches and the volleyball families” coach Melissa Gales said. “Today many things connected, at times we dominated and hit the lights out of the ball. The team chemistry is phenomenal and the girls are having fun.” Morenci Tournament Marcellus lost just one game Saturday on their way to capturing first place in the Morenci Tournament Saturday. In the finals the Lady Wildcats defeated Morenci 25-16, 25-17 in the finals. Marcellus opened the tourney with a 25-17, 25-14 win over Summerfield and beat Waldron 25-17, 25-11. The Lady Wildcats then split with Morenci 25-22, 23-25, then won matches over Hudson 25-7, 25-13, Waldron 25-19, 25-23 and Morenci in the championship. “It wasn’t our sharpest performance of the season, but the girls played well when it counted,” coach Tony Hooley said. Madison Fisher had 101 assists, 29 digs, seven aces and one kill, Helis Sala had 57 kills, eight digs, five blocks and four aces, Aleyna Hudson added 44 digs, 18 aces and 27 kills and Grace Mihills had 18 kills, nine blocks, seven kills and two aces. Rochelle Zachrich had 48 digs and three aces, Mackenzie Buck added six kills three blocks and two assists, Elena Gemello had 42 digs, 16 kills, seven assists, seven aces and two blocks and Jade Sibley had 12 digs. Melissa Steinkraus had four kills and one dig, Cheyenne Goodenough added eight digs, Olivia Wildes had 15 assists, five digs and three kills and Samantha Daugherty had three kills and one dig. Harper Creek Invite Mendon had their day ended in bracket play by Harper Creek 25-22, 25-11. The Lady Hornets opened the tourney splitting with Three Rivers 19-25, 26-24, then falling to Harper Creek 25-23, 25-17 and ending pool play beating Athens 25-13, 25-13. Megann Leighton had 38 kills and four blocks, Kasey Smith added 89 digs and seven aces and Brandy Deleter had 15 kills and two blocks. “We’re in a lull right know, we’re not playing well,” coach Bill Trenary said. “We need to recommit ourselves.” Three Rivers had their day ended in bracket play with a loss to Battle Creek St. Philip 25-16, 25-16. The Lady Cats opened pool play with a split with Mendon, then a win over Athens 25-13, 25-19. They ended pool play with a loss to Harper Creek 25-13, 25-20. Tessa Hawkins had 82 digs, Abby Springer had six blocks, Zoey Wilson, Megan Southland and Shelby Krawczak combined for 15 kills.
